commText: Kohli and du Plessis are at the crease. Kohli is on strike. Tushar Deshpande will open the attack
Tushar Deshpande to Kohli, 1 run, back of a length and well wide of off, Kohli rides the bounce and steers it behind square on the off-side for a single
Tushar Deshpande to du Plessis, no run, fuller length delivery on the pads, du Plessis leans across and nudges it to the on-side
Tushar Deshpande to du Plessis, no run, on a good length and just outside off, du Plessis lets the ball come and defends it to backward point
Tushar Deshpande to du Plessis, no run, fuller length delivery on off, du Plessis leans forward and can't beat cover-point with the drive
Tushar Deshpande to du Plessis, no run, swing and a miss - du Plessis charges down the pitch, but Deshpande slips in the awayswinger - the right-hander looks to swipe it over cover and missed
Tushar Deshpande to du Plessis, 1 run, excellent start from Deshpande - short of a good length and just outside off, du Plessis comes down the pitch and stabs iut in front of cover-point for a run
Shardul Thakur, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Thakur to du Plessis, 1 run, short of a good length and well wide of off, du Plessis flays it over cover, but there's a fielder in the deep, just a single

Thakur to Kohli, FOUR, nicely played, first boundary of the game - back of a length and well wide of off, Kohli lets the ball come, used the pace on the ball and then runs it backward of square on the off-side, beats the fielder in the deep
A drizzle has just started at Chinnaswamy
Thakur to Kohli, 1 run, on a good length and just outside off, Kohli leans well forward and places the drive past cover for a single
Kaushik pings this from the venue: Quite electric the atmosphere. Fans split down the middle I would say. RCB chants morph midway into CSK. Sounds like RC..K
Thakur to du Plessis, no run, du Plessis is struggling here - short and well wide of off, doesn't come on as well as he expected, swings across the line and misses

Thakur to du Plessis, FOUR, beautifully played, that'll take some pressure off du Plessis - on a good length and well wide of off, du Plessis throws his hands on the drive and places it wide of cover. Santner came running across in the deep, makes a half-stop, but the ball rolls onto the advertisement skirting

Thakur to du Plessis, SIX, 16 off the over, much better from du Plessis - length ball on off, he leans forward, straight bat and a high elbow, thumps it back over the bowler's head and sends it soaring over the straight boundary
Virat Kohli on 18th May in IPL 56*(29) vs CSK Bengaluru 2013 27(29) vs CSK Ranchi 2015 113(50) vs PK Bengaluru 2016 100(63) vs SRH Hyderabad 2023

Tushar Deshpande to Kohli, SIX, magnificent, that's hit the roof of Chinnaswamy - back of a length and angling into the right-hander, Kohli swivels across, picks the length early and then pulls it high over long leg
Tushar Deshpande to Kohli, no run, on a good length and just outside off, driven on the rise and straight to the fielder at cover
Most runs at a venue in IPL 3005* V Kohli at Chinnaswamy 2295 Rohit Sharma at Wankhede 1960 AB de Villiers at Chinnaswamy

Tushar Deshpande to Kohli, SIX, they're dealing in sixes at the moment - Deshpande dragged the length back as Kohli gave the charge, but he still rolled his wrists and then powered the pull over square leg
Tushar Deshpande to Kohli, no run, good comeback from Deshpande - shortened the length and got it to straighten onto the right-hander, Kohli shimmies down the pitch and is beaten on the outside edge
Tushar Deshpande to Kohli, no run, short and just outside off - Kohli picked the length on the pull, but he's through with the shot early and toe-ends it back at the bowler
The drizzle has stopped now

Tushar Deshpande to Kohli, 1 run, streaky, a low full-toss as Kohli gave the charge, he closed the face of the bat early and the edge rolled behind square on the off-side for a single, 13 off the over

19:45 Local Time, 14:15 GMT, 19:45 IST: It has started to rain and the players are off. It's a steady downpour and it's pelting down on the covers. A heavy shower now, pings Kaushik. More and more covers are being brought to cover the square, doesn't look too good, but we do have 1 hour before we start losing overs. We also have the sub-air system here which helps the ground drain rapidly once the rain stops.

19:50 Local Time, 14:20 GMT, 19:50 IST: Kaushik pings to say that the rain has lessened in intensity. It's a steady downpour now, but the pitch and the entire square has been well covered. 'It's a mere drizzle now', pings Kaushik once again. The groundstaff are making their way to the ground.
Fewest tosses won by a team in the group stage 2 RR in 2022 3 LSG in 2023 3 GT in 2024 3 KKR in 2024 3 CSK in 2024 *

19:55 Local Time, 14:25 GMT, 19:55 IST: Chris Gayle is in the house today and he's obviously supporting RCB. More on the game - the supersoppers are doing its work, the groundstaff are awaiting instructions before they start removing the covers. As I type, they've started removing the covers. That's good news for RCB and its fans.

20:00 Local Time, 14:30 GMT, 20:00 IST: The big cover still remains, the rain has definitely stopped though and we should have a restart soon. The 4th umpire has taken charge, the areas around the covers are being dried and once it's done, they'll probably start removing the big sheets covering the pitch. Faf du Plessis and Virat Kohli are back into the dug-out and that's a positive sign.

20:05 Local Time, 14:35 GMT, 20:05 IST: I can see movement near the big covers, the umpires are huddled together, but Kaushik pings to say that there could still be a thin drizzle persisting and that could be the reason for the big covers to stay in place. The fans who were on the lower tier and without any protection from the rain have come back to their seats.
Good news, the covers are being peeled off. The hessain has been removed as well, the stumps are being put in place and a restart should be imminent. We're going to restart at 8:25 pm.
The players are back out in the middle and we're ready for the resumption. CSK will start with spin and it's Theekshana.
Theekshana to Kohli, 1 run, tossed up and drifting onto the pads, clipped through mid-wicket for a single
Theekshana to du Plessis, no run, dropped short and wide of off, du Plessis chops it straight to the fielder at cover-point
Theekshana to du Plessis, no run, flighted delivery on middle, pushed back at the bowler
Theekshana to du Plessis, no run, turn and bounce for Theekshana - saw du Plessis backing away and pushed it quicker, gripped off the surface and struck the batter on the right shoulder
Theekshana to du Plessis, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, nudged in front of square on the on-side for a single
Theekshana to Kohli, wide, more turn, more turn, but this one slides down leg and is called as a wide - Kohli was shaping for the pull and is undone by the slowness of the delivery
Theekshana to Kohli, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, worked in front of square on the on-side for a single
Mitchell Santner, Left arm orthodox, comes into the attack
Santner to Kohli, no run, nicely bowled, Santner slows down the pace on off, hint of turn and grip - Kohli backed away on the drive and gets a thick edge, on the bounce to short fine
Santner to Kohli, 1 run, more hints of a two-paced pitch - turn and grip from off, Kohli had backed away and could only tamely push it to the off-side
Santner to du Plessis, no run, flatter and drifting down leg, du Plessis backs away on the cut and is beaten on the inside edge

Santner to du Plessis, no run, appeal for a stumping, but MS doesn't look too keen, slower and drifting away from off, du Plessis backed away on the inside out drive and missed, he did drag his feet forward, but was back before the wicket was broken. The 3rd umpire has a couple of looks and NOT OUT is the call
Santner to du Plessis, 1 run, dragged short by Santner - du Plessis rocks back and pulls it to deep mid-wicket, on the bounce to the fielder
Santner to Kohli, no run, more turn and nore grip from off, Kohli backs away and is left surprised as the ball drifts away from his reach

Over Summary (1-5) -> Tushar Deshpande concedes only 2 runs in the opening over -> Thakur concedes 16 runs in his opening over -> Rain stops play, 40 minutes delayed, no overs lost -> CSK spinners bowl a couple of lovely overs, grip and turn on offer
Just 6 runs from 2 overs since the resumption - the ball has gripped, turned and has made stroke-making extremely difficult
Theekshana to du Plessis, no run, du Plessis looks frustrated now, flatter and at the stumps, he backs away on the slap and is beaten on the inside edge, didn't miss the leg-stump by much
Theekshana to du Plessis, FOUR, thumped, relief for du Plessis - flighted delivery on middle, he backs away and then goes over the bowler's head, couple of bounces and over the ropes
Theekshana to du Plessis, no run, pushed through by Theekshana, du Plessis is cramped for room as he pushes it back at the bowler
Theekshana to du Plessis, no run, flighted delivery on off, grips and turns, makes du Plessis look flustered as he threw his bat on the slog
Theekshana to du Plessis, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle, slugged away wide of mid-wicket for a single
Theekshana to Kohli, no run, dropped short and drifting back into the right-hander - Kohli slogs across the line and misses, struck high on the body
A slip for RJ
Ravindra Jadeja, Left arm orthodox, comes into the attack
Pace: 0/31 in 3 overs (2 X 4s , 3 X 6s) \nSpin: 0/11 in 3 overs (1 X 4s)
Jadeja to du Plessis, 1 run, tossed up on off, du Plessis backs away and inside halves the shovel, bounces through to long-on
Kaushik pings this from the venue: Faf had a word with the umpire at the end of that over, pointing at the pitch...
Jadeja to Kohli, FOUR, edged and four, dropped short by RJ - Kohli backed away and went hard on the cut, gets a thick edge that lobs wide of short third man and runs away to the ropes
Jadeja to Kohli, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle, Kohli backs away and cuts it square on the off-side for a single
Jadeja to du Plessis, 2 runs, tossed up on middle and leg, tucked in front of square on the on-side and du Plessis scampers back for the second
Jadeja to du Plessis, 1 run, flighted delivery on off, punched in front of square on the off-side for a single

Jadeja to Kohli, 1 run, tossed up just outside off, Kohli makes room and dabs it to short third man, they're off for a quick single and there's a direct hit at the striker's end, but du Plessis has made his ground with ease. The 3rd umpire has a look, 10 off the over
Mitchell Santner [1.0-0-2-0] is back into the attack
Santner to Kohli, no run, that has turned square, pushed through on middle and leg - Kohli makes room and is then opened up by the angle, beaten on the outside edge
Santner to Kohli, FOUR, cracking shot, dropped short by Santner - Kohli makes room and then clears extra-cover with a thumping cut, runs away to the ropes in a hurry
Santner to Kohli, no run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, Kohli prods across and pushes it back at the bowler
Santner to Kohli, 1 run, Santner tosses one on off, driven down towards long-off for a single
Santner to du Plessis, 2 runs, flighted delivery and spinning away from off, du Plessis plays late and then places the open-afced drive past point, comes back for the second run
Santner to du Plessis, 1 run, tight line around middle, pushed in front of cover for a single, 8 off the over
Jadeja to du Plessis, 2 runs, slower and wider of off, du Plessis backs away and then goes over cover with the back-foot drive, Rachin gets across and fumbles, but he recovers to prevent the boundary
Jadeja to du Plessis, 1 run, tossed up on off, drilled back at the bowler who makes a half-stop, keeping them down to a single
Jadeja to Kohli, no run, dropped short and wide of off, cut away straight to the fielder at cover
Jadeja to Kohli, no run, flatter and spinning away from off - Kohli backs away, opens the face of the bat and then looks to run it past MS, beaten by the4 extra bounce

Jadeja to Kohli, SIX, lovely, tad too full from RJ - lets Kohli go down onto his knee and he then plays the slog-sweep, sending it high and wide of mid-wicket for a maximum. He enjoyed that, RCB need many more of those
Jadeja to Kohli, 1 run, RJ drags the length back, gets some turn and forces Kohli into a miscue on the cut, a single wide of cover
Most sixes in IPL 2024 36* V Kohli 36 N Pooran 35 Abhishek Sharma 32 S Narine

Time for the strategic break. The game has done a U-turn since the rain break. There's grip, turn and bounce on offer and Ruturaj has smartly bowled 5 overs of spin, conceding just 39 runs. Both batters looked frustrated at times, but they're slowly coming into grips with the situation.

Kaushik with this from the venue: 4 follow-up batters - Maxwell, Green, Lomror and Patidar have walked in at the STO to get the intel on the pitch. Usually it's the next two batters that come in for RCB.
Santner to Kohli, 1 run, tossed up on middle and leg, tucked in front of short third for a single
Santner to du Plessis, 1 run, pushed through on middle, tucked through mid-wicket for a single - the crowd roar as MS gives the chase
Santner to Kohli, SIX, clubbed, Kohli is bringing the slog-sweep into play, picked the length early, got down onto his knee and then swiped it over mid-wicket for a maximum

Kohli - 701 runs in 2024 \n10th instance of a batter aggregating 700+ runs in a season, Kohli the second batter to do it on two seperate instances (973 in 2016 & 701* in 2024) after Chris Gayle (733 in 2012 & 708 in 2013).
Santner to Kohli, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Santner to Kohli, out Caught by Mitchell!! A tag catch from Mitchell, he's sure that he's taken it cleanly, the 3rd umpire will have a look, but Kohli is already walking back to the dug-out. Lovely delivery from Santner, drifted in and then spun away from the leg-stump line - Kohli was shaping for the whip, closed the face of the bat as he played against the turn, a big edge and the ball lobbed down to long-on. Mitchell kept his eyes on the ball as he backpedalled, took the catch, realised that he's stepping onto the ropes, throws the ball up, recovers and then takes it on the rebound. Kohli c Mitchell b Santner 47(29) [4s-3 6s-4]
Rajat Patidar, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Santner to Rajat Patidar, no run, nicely bowled, tossed up on off, grips and turns past Patidar's forward push
Santner to Rajat Patidar, no run, beaten, this is excellent bowling from Santner - gets it to angle in and then rips past Patidar's outside edge

Over Summary (6-10) -> 50 up for RCB in the 7th over -> A dip in the run rate with the pitch turning square -> Kohli breaks the shackles against Jadeja, smashes a six over deep mid-wicket -> Santner breaks the opening partnership, Kohli is caught at long-on -> Patidar walks out to bat at number 3, things under control for CSK
Jadeja to du Plessis, 2 runs, flatter and at the stumps, whipped in front of square on the on-side - du Plessis comes back for the second
Jadeja to du Plessis, FOUR, cracking shot, tossed up well outside off - du Plessis backs away, opens up the off-side and then hammers the drive past extra-cover, races away to the ropes
Jadeja to du Plessis, 1 run, tossed up slower and just outside off, punched into the gap wide of cover for a single
Jadeja to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, pushed through on the leg-stump line, worked wide of mid-on for a single
Jadeja to du Plessis, SIX, lovely, du Plessis shimmies down the pitch, gets to the half-volley and then drills it back over RJ's head, hits the sightscreen on the full

Jadeja to du Plessis, SIX, 20 off the over, RJ slows down the pace, but it's too full and right in du Plessis's slot, he backs away, opens up the off-side and then goes inside out over cover for a maximum
Maheesh Theekshana [2.0-0-9-0] is back into the attack
Theekshana to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, flatter and on off, Patidar makes room and hammers it back past the bowler for a single
Most sixes in an IPL season for Virat Kohli 38 in 2016 37 in 2024 * 23 in 2015 22 in 2013
Theekshana to du Plessis, 1 run, low full-toss from Theekshana, nudged towards mid-on and the single brings up du Plessis's fifty
Theekshana to Rajat Patidar, SIX, thumped, tad too short from Theekshana - Patidar stands tall and then hammers it back over the bowler's head, sent it sailing over long-off for a maximum
Theekshana to Rajat Patidar, no run, tossed up just outside off, Patidar goes right back and pushes it to the off-side
Theekshana to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, very full and on off, driven down to long-on for a single
Theekshana to du Plessis, 1 run, dropped slow and short of off, flat-batted down to long-off for a single
Mitchell Santner [3.0-0-18-1] is back into the attack
Santner to du Plessis, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, clipped away through mid-wicket for a single
Santner to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, Santner follows Patidar as he backed away, clipped past mid-wicket for a single
Santner to du Plessis, 1 run, very full from Santner, slugged away to long-on for a single
Santner to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, flighted delivery on middle and leg, nudged past square leg for a single
Santner to du Plessis, 1 run, Santner slows down the pace on middele - du Plessis backs away and cuts it square past point for a single
Santner to Rajat Patidar, THATS OUT!! Run Out!!

Santner to Rajat Patidar, out du Plessis Run Out!! Appeal for a run-out at the bowler's end. Was du Plessis backing up too far? The 3rd umpire will have a look - was tossed up and Rajat Patidar drilled it back at the bowler - Santner got a fingertip and there's a deviation, was the bat in the air? Umpire Michael Gough has several looks, he does conclude that the bat was in the air. He now wants to verify if Santner did get a touch, he did and UltraEdge confirms it. That's OUT and Faf is OUT. He looks surprised, shrugs his head away and walks back to the dug-out. Excellent from Santner to get down low and intercept that straight drive from Patidar, a wicket out of nowhere and CSK section of the crowd go berserk with joy. du Plessis run out (Santner) 54(39) [4s-3 6s-3]
Cameron Green, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Simarjeet Singh, right-arm fast medium, comes into the attack
Simarjeet Singh to Green, 1 run, on the shorter side, Green pulls it towards deep square leg for a single
Some issue with the landing area, we have a small delay in play

Simarjeet Singh to Rajat Patidar, FOUR, edged away to the boundary! Width on offer outside off, Rajat Patidar throws his hands at it and the outside edge flies past Dhoni. Would have been interesting had there been a slip in place

Simarjeet Singh to Rajat Patidar, SIX, even better from Rajat Patidar! On the batter's pads and Rajat Patidar has flicked it over fine leg for half-a-dozen. He has been doing this over the last few games, one of the reasons for RCB's resurgence. Gaikwad walks up to the bowler and has a word with him
Simarjeet Singh to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, pitched up by the bowler on off, Rajat Patidar square drives it for a single
A few changes in the field..
Simarjeet Singh to Green, wide, and Simarjeet Singh delivers a wide ball after all his field changes
Simarjeet Singh to Green, wide, another wide delivery outside off as Simarjeet Singh is struggling with his line
Simarjeet Singh to Green, FOUR, Simarjeet Singh continues to concede runs. This was wide outside off and Green crunches it through cover-point for a cracking boundary
Simarjeet Singh to Green, 1 run, yorker length ball outside off, Green squeezes it to third man for a single
Maheesh Theekshana [3.0-0-19-0] is back into the attack
Theekshana to Green, no run, pushed through outside off, Green gets beaten as he tries to slice it away
Theekshana to Green, 1 run, way too full on off, Green drives it to long-off for a single
Theekshana to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, way too full on the pads, clipped through square leg for a single
Theekshana to Green, no run, full and straight on off, Green drives it to the fielder at cover

Theekshana to Green, FOUR, stand and deliver. Not from the middle of the bat, but was played right over the bowler's head. He went full and Green smashed it over Theekshana's head, managed to beat the couple of fielders in the deep
Theekshana to Green, no run, makes room, tries to cut this shortish delivery away, gets beaten though

Over Summary (11-15 ov) * Jadeja concedes 20 runs in the 11th over of the innings * Rajat Patidar joins the fun with a well struck six off Theekshana * Unlucky dismissal for du Plessis, he's run-out backing up for 59 * Simarjeet Singh concedes 19 runs in the 14th over
Shardul Thakur [1.0-0-16-0] is back into the attack

Thakur to Rajat Patidar, FOUR, full and wide outside off, Rajat Patidar slashes away from his body and gets an outside edge that flies over short third man. The fielder tried to grab it with a leap but couldn't even get his hand to it
Review taken for an lbw! Thakur was excited, but ths impact is clearly outside off..

Thakur to Rajat Patidar, leg byes, 1 run, Dhoni wasn't interested at all, however, Thakur convinced his captain (Gaikwad) to review it. This was a full length delivery outside off and Rajat Patidar was a long way across to play the sweep, got rapped on the pads and the impact was outside off clearly. CSK have lost a review
Most sixes in a T20 competition 150* RCB in IPL 2024 146 SRH in IPL 2024 145 CSK in IPL 2018 144 Surrey in T20 Blast 2023 143 KKR in IPL 2019
Thakur to Green, SIX, that's the power he possesses. A low full toss and Green has thumped it over long-on as he just manages to beat the fielder near the boundary
Thakur to Green, 1 run, full and wide outside off, Green drills this to wide long-off for a single. 150 up for RCB
Thakur to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, yorker length ball on off, turns out to be a low full toss, Rajat Patidar gets it off the inside edge towards the on-side
Thakur to Green, FOUR, dropped and a boundary! This was pitched up and Green smashes it towards long-off. Gaikwad in the deep puts it down and gives away a boundary as well

Timeout! Match interestingly poised as RCB are in a healthy position.. Reminds me of the CSK - GT final of 2023. A high-scoring game, rain adding a touch of drama. Let's see what unfolds in the next 4 overs..
Tushar Deshpande [2.0-0-15-0] is back into the attack

Tushar Deshpande to Rajat Patidar, SIX, smoked over the boundary. 200 on the cards. Back of a length around off and Rajat Patidar has launched it over long-on, manages to beat the fielder in the deep. Whistles all around the Chinnaswamy
Kaushik pings this during the timeout: lot of ropes running on the outfield.

Tushar Deshpande to Rajat Patidar, 1 run, miscued but Rahane doesn't go for the catch. He might have run faster and put in a dive in his younger days. Was a low full toss as Rajat Patidar got a toe end towards long-off, one bounce towards the fielder
Tushar Deshpande to Green, 1 run, 50-run stand up as Green drives the low full to long-off
Tushar Deshpande to Rajat Patidar, no run, short and slow on off, keeps a touch low, Rajat Patidar has a swing and a miss
Tushar Deshpande to Rajat Patidar, wide, way too wide outside off, just misses the tramline
Tushar Deshpande to Rajat Patidar, no run, short and slow on off, Rajat Patidar goes for a pull, gets hit on the helmet. The physio has the mandatory check, Patidar looks fine though
Tushar Deshpande to Rajat Patidar, wide, way too wide outside off as Rajat Patidar bowls another extra
Tushar Deshpande to Rajat Patidar, SIX, smashed into the stands. Gets hold of it and swings it high into the night sky, clears deep mid-wicket does Rajat Patidar
Thakur to Green, SIX, juicy full toss, Green gets hold of it and spanks it over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen. Thakur has been ordinary tonight. The ball has been changed
Thakur to Green, SIX, back-to-back sixes. Thakur goes tad short and Green smokes it over deep mid-wicket. The crowd is absolutely loving it
Thakur to Green, 1 run, yorker length ball at the stumps, Green squeezes it towards long-on
Thakur to Rajat Patidar, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Thakur to Rajat Patidar, out Caught by Mitchell!! Rajat Patidar walks back after playing a superb knock. A full toss by Thakur and Rajat Patidar lofts it towards long-on. Mitchell takes it, gets rid of the ball before overhauling the boundary and comes back to complete it on the second attempt. Some respite for Thakur who has been taken to the cleaners tonight. Rajat Patidar c Mitchell b Thakur 41(23) [4s-2 6s-4]
Dinesh Karthik, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Thakur to Karthik, 2 runs, yorker length ball outside off, Karthik squeezes it to third man for a couple of runs, stopped by Jadeja
Thakur to Karthik, 1 run, low full toss, whipped to mid-wicket for a single by DK
Tushar Deshpande to Karthik, 1 run, another full toss on off, Karthik squeezes it through point for a single
Tushar Deshpande to Green, wide, way too wide outside off, Green has a swing and a miss. A review taken by CSK, but this is a wide, the onfield call stays
Tushar Deshpande to Green, 1 run, low full toss on off, Green smashes it back to Tushar Deshpande who gets hit on the leg, parries the ball towards long-on
Tushar Deshpande to Karthik, wide, too short, too wide, misses the tramline outside off
Tushar Deshpande to Karthik, SIX, pitched up by the bowler on off, Karthik shuffles across and heaves it over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen. Just clears the boundary
Kaushik pings this: Dhoni unhappy with TD for not bowling wide enough. Gesturing , 'you bowled it right under his bat swing'

Tushar Deshpande to Karthik, FOUR, this is the shot he played on several occasions against Mumbai Indians earlier this season. Was looking to ramp this ball, but Tushar Deshpande went wide outside off. Karthik adjusts late, improvises and guides it past Dhoni in the end
Tushar Deshpande to Karthik, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Tushar Deshpande to Karthik, out Caught by Dhoni!! Edged and taken! Full and wide outside off, Karthik throws his hands at it and gets an outside edge that has been taken by MSD. Karthik walks back after playing a cameo. Has taken RCB past the 200-run mark. Karthik c Dhoni b Tushar Deshpande 14(6) [4s-1 6s-1]
Glenn Maxwell, right handed bat, comes to the crease
Tushar Deshpande to Maxwell, FOUR, on the shorter side, Maxwell goes for the reverse ramp, gets a top edge that flies over the keeper. Runs coming thick and fast
Most 200+ totals in a single edition of IPL 6 Mumbai Indians in 2023 6 Kolkata Knight Riders in 2024 6 Royal Challengers Bengaluru in 2024 *
Thakur to Green, 1 run, low full toss by Thakur, Green lofts it towards long-on on the bounce
Thakur to Maxwell, 2 runs, full in the slot, Maxwell whips it to deep mid-wicket for a couple of runs
Thakur to Maxwell, SIX, juicy full toss by Thakur, Maxwell stays put and swings it over deep mid-wicket for half-a-dozen. All about power was that shot
Thakur to Maxwell, FOUR, that's another full toss by Thakur and Maxwell has lofted it over cover, just manages to clear the infield. What a cameo this is proving to be...
Thakur to Maxwell, THATS OUT!! Caught!!

Thakur to Maxwell, out Caught by Dhoni!! Slower delivery does the trick. Maxwell tries to take him, goes hard at it and miscues it completely. The ball goes high up in the night sky and Dhoni calls for it, settles underneath to complete a safe catch. Maxwell c Dhoni b Thakur 16(5) [4s-2 6s-1]
Mahipal Lomror, left handed bat, comes to the crease

Thakur to Lomror, no run, RCB finish with 218/5! CSK need 219 to win, they need 201 to qualify for the playoffs. A full length ball outside off, Lomror has a swing and a miss. A dot to end the innings

21:57 Local Time, 16:27 GMT, 21:57 IST: That's quite a challenging total posted by RCB, however, CSK bat deep and the pitch has eased down. Looks like a beauty to bat on - the smaller boundaries are an added advantage to the chasing team. Virat and Faf du Plessis played impressive knocks to set the platform and although the pitch was turning square after the rain break, the RCB openers didn't throw their wickets away and put up a fight. Kohli missed out on his fifty as Santner removed him in the 10th over, however, skipper Faf notched up a solid fifty before he was unfortunately run-out at the bowler's end. Patidar and Green had a fabulous partnership thereafter and the pair entertained the crowd to the core. DK and Maxwell played cameos towards the end as RCB finished with 218/5. Like I said before, CSK had a similar target to chase down last year in the final and given their ability to deliver in must-win games, this match is interestingly poised. RCB bowling? Are they up for this challenge? We shall find out soon..
Highest totals for RCB vs CSK in IPL 218/5 Bengaluru 2024 (???) 218/8 Bengaluru 2023 (Lost) 205/8 Chennai 2012 (Lost) 205/8 Bengaluru 2018 (Lost) 175/4 Mumbai WS (Lost)

Most expensive figures for CSK in IPL 0/62 L Ngidi vs MI Delhi 2021 2/61 S Thakur vs RCB Bengaluru 2024 0/60 Simarjeet SIngh vs GT Ahmedabad 2024

Cameron Green - For sure, the wicket was quite tough, when you bowl into the wicket, there was some bounce, I hope it stays the same in the second innings. Pretty crazy (on conditions changing after the rain break), Faf and Virat batted beautifully (against spin), gave us a nice little platform, they assessed the conditions well. Don't know why it happened, but it was the same in Dharamsala as well. You can't put a figure on that, it's been the beauty of this season's IPL, it's not about keeping any score in mind, just have to get going and play your shots right from the start.
Back live for the run chase.. RCB gathered in a huddle. Can the CSK top-order fire like the RCB top-order did? Or will they need their finishers to rise up to the occasion tonight? Let's find out..
